Author: axo777#1232
Content: GPS Signals probably arriving in API's, cell network signals, RFID readers in warehouses, hospitals, retail stores, libraries, etc, etc are the targets here.  If we can build a working group to start testing we hopefully can have one or 2 working samples to show people.  I really like the DragonHound work you did @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator

Author: axo777#1232
Content: What kind of signal is coming in from particle.io?

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: Basically, aim is data visualization of iot via oracle. Still lots to do tho. Its a big landscape.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: I set firmware to report lon/lat and battery. Small json string. Curls to oracle, with aes encryption. Front end queries and decrypts for display.

Author: axo777#1232
Content: I have one user who I have talking about our features, tx/sec, etc. who just attended a blockchain conference.  He said that all of the presenters there were hesitant about their capabilities regarding speed, scalability and privacy.  All issues we have met.  This user has nice API's for the data source and many end users ready to sign up after a successful test(s).

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: Gps data rate is long interval to conserve power, but continuous streams are doable. Once Dragonhound done, Ill work on something over wifi instead of 3g to test that side of it.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @axo777 `We need to design a smart phone app that will register and pay the fee and upload its edge signals to the Oracle CC` That's where I would start. You need some way to create transactions, signing them and broadcasting them without the actual chain

Content: or just crypto conditions SPV

Author: Alright#0419
Content: You could use trusted explorer to at least broadcast them. Creating them and signing them might not be so easy

Content: When I said user friendly, i meant user friendly.  I have thousands of end users.  They all have desktop computers and can handle web pages and no more.  We have to make the blockchain invisible for them.
